channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Salah a target for Saudi, confirms league chief
item.description: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah is a target for clubs in the Saudi Pro League, confirms chief executive Omar Mugharbel.

item.title: BBC to show Scotland's first World Cup game since 1998
item.description: The BBC will broadcast Scotland's first World Cup match since 1998, when they take on Haiti on 14 June, plus their final group match against Brazil and England's group match against Ghana.

item.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
item.description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

item.title: BBC or ITV? Inside how World Cup broadcast picks are made
item.description: We now know the broadcast schedule for the 2026 World Cup, but how do BBC and ITV decide who shows which matches?

item.title: 'A sense of panic' - what's going on in Turkish football?
item.description: A wide-ranging investigation into illegal gambling involving figures in Turkish football is underway with hundreds of players, club owners and referees under scrutiny, BBC Sport looks at what's going on.

item.title: Gabriel, 15, among crop aiming to preserve 87-year Man Utd record
item.description: BBC Sport's Simon Stone checks in on the progress of the young players who will be tasked with preserving a proud 87-year-old record at Manchester United.

item.title: Why have Nancy's Celtic tactics board & green shoes caused consternation?
item.description: Why have a mini tactics board and a pair of trainers caused a stir within Scottish football this week?

item.title: England to play Uruguay and Japan in March
item.description: England will take on Uruguay and Japan at Wembley in March in their final two games before Thomas Tuchel names his 2026 World Cup squad.

item.title: Son, Simons and mini Spurs revival lift Frank's spirits
item.description: Son Heung-min's emotional return sets the tone for another significant step forward for Spurs and head coach Thomas Frank, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Mbappe in squad to face Man City despite injury reports
item.description: Real Madrid include Kylian Mbappe in their squad to face Manchester City on Wednesday, despite injury doubts over the France forward.

item.title: Man Utd and Arsenal reach Champions League knockouts - what do Chelsea need?
item.description: BBC Sport assesses how Arsenal, Chelsea and Man Utd have fared so far in this season's Women's Champions League with two league phase rounds remaining.

item.title: Egypt want World Cup 'Pride Match' plans cancelled
item.description: The organisation behind the LGBTQ+ "Pride Match" at the 2026 World Cup say they intend to push forward with their plans despite one of the teams involved objecting to Fifa.

item.title: Salah's five-hour bus journey to football training aged 12
item.description: How Mohamed Salah defied the odds and never gave up on his challenging journey from rural Egypt to become a footballer.

item.title: Why 'phenomenon' Williams is on radar of Europe's top clubs
item.description: BBC Sport asks fans and experts in Bilbao to explain why Athletic Club winger Nico Williams is attracting the attention of Europe's biggest clubs in his debut Champions League season.

item.title: Man Utd score four as winless Wolves booed
item.description: Watch highlights as Wolves lose 4-1 to Manchester United, suffering their eighth-straight loss in the Premier League.

item.title: Slot 'no clue' if Salah has played his last Liverpool game
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "I have no clue" when asked if Mohamed Salah has played his last game for Liverpool.

item.title: A European giant - but what's happened to the modern-day Ajax?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the demise of Ajax in recent years and whether their fortunes could be about to change

item.title: Salah top priority for Saudi league - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Saudi Arabia keen to bring Mohamed Salah to league in January, Antoine Semenyo prefers Liverpool move but Arsenal and Manchester City also interested.

item.title: 'Give Alonso time' - but Man City visit could be pivotal
item.description: Real Madrid's Champions League meeting with Manchester City is a make-or-break match for under-fire home boss Xabi Alonso.

item.title: Would Liverpool have got 'soft' penalty in Premier League?
item.description: Liverpool's late winner at Inter Milan in the Champions League came from a "soft" penalty decision, but would it have been given in the Premier League?

item.title: Pogba invests in Saudi Arabian camel racing team
item.description: France's World Cup winner Paul Pogba is moving into the sport of camel racing after investing in Saudi Arabia-based team Al Haboob.

item.title: Big result for Slot and Liverpool with no Salah in Milan
item.description: Liverpool win away in the Champions League without Mohamed Salah for the first time since 2009, in a big night for boss Arne Slot.

item.title: Fifa accused of breaching own rules with Trump award
item.description: Gianni Infantino is accused of breaking Fifa rules by a campaign group after giving United States President Donald Trump a peace prize.

item.title: More clubs could face European expulsion after Uefa ruling
item.description: More teams could be thrown out of European competitions after Uefa said it would continue its hard-line position on multi-club ownership.

item.title: Spurs move Pride flag over 'security concerns'
item.description: Tottenham's LGBTQI+ supporters group criticises Champions League opponents Slavia Prague after the Czech club requests the relocation of a flag.

item.title: 'Not nice' for Hobinger to be named in stalking case
item.description: Liverpool boss Gareth Taylor is unhappy midfielder Marie Hobinger was named as the victim in a stalking case but says she is doing "OK" following her ordeal.

item.title: Messi wins historic back-to-back MLS MVP awards
item.description: Inter Miami forward Lionel Messi becomes the first player in MLS history to win back-to-back Most Valuable Player awards.

item.title: 'A really dangerous circle' - Arteta on Arsenal injuries
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta say the injuries his squad are suffering this season are not a result of overtraining.

item.title: How did Littler get Man Utd away tickets - and why has it sparked debate?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore how Luke Littler got Manchester United away tickets against Wolves on Monday evening.

item.title: Zaha in Ivory Coast Afcon squad but Adingra left out
item.description: Afcon holders Ivory Coast announce their 26-man squad for the 2025 edition, with a recall for Wilfried Zaha after nearly two years out of the national team.

item.title: Chelsea 'not in crisis', says defiant Bright
item.description: Chelsea captain Millie Bright says the defending Women's Super League champions are not facing a crisis after losing 1-0 to Everton on Sunday - their first league defeat since May 2024.

item.title: Celtic legend Deans dies aged 79
item.description: Former Motherwell, Celtic and Scotland striker John 'Dixie' Deans has died aged 79.

item.title: England and Spurs' Naz out for season with ACL injury
item.description: England and Tottenham forward Jess Naz has suffered an anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury and will miss the rest of the season.

item.title: Villa could still go up another level - Sutton
item.description: Chris Sutton and Conor Coady discuss Aston Villa's title credentials and their admiration for manager Unai Emery on the Monday Night Club.

item.title: 'I understand their anger' - Edwards on Wolves fans' boos
item.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Rob Edwards says he can understand some of the anger fans have with the club following their 4-1 defeat at home to Manchester United.

item.title: Shade scores hat-trick as Burton beat non-league Brackley
item.description: Watch highlights as Burton Albion beat Brackley Town 3-1 to reach the FA Cup third round, thanks to a hat-trick from Tyrese Shade.

item.title: Amorim hails Mount after win at Wolves
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim praises the performance of Mason Mount after the midfielder scored in a 4-1 win at Wolves

item.title: 'Disrespectful' Salah comments threw club under bus - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney says the critical comments made by Mohamed Salah after Liverpool's 3-3 draw with Leeds were "disrespectful" and have thrown the club "under the bus".

item.title: Smith & Blackstenius star in WSL goals of the week
item.description: Arsenal stars Olivia Smith and Stina Balckstenius both feature in the best goals from the weekend's Women's Super League action.

item.title: 'Salah's put his team-mates in jeopardy' - Coady
item.description: Chris Sutton and Conor Coady break down Mohamed Salah's fallout with Liverpool on the Monday Night Club.

item.title: Guehi scores late header to secure Crystal Palace win over Fulham
item.description: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi scores a late header for a 2-1 win against Fulham which moves them into the top four in the Premier League.

item.title: Brighton equalise in stoppage time against West Ham
item.description: Georginio Rutter scores a controversial equaliser for Brighton as they draw 1-1 to deny West Ham United the chance to escape the relegation zone.

item.title: Nine-man Real Madrid implode in home defeat to Celta Vigo
item.description: Real Madrid lose 2-0 at home to Celta Vigo in La Liga, going down to nine-men in the process after both Fran Garcia and Alvaro Carreras are sent off.

item.title: Watch: Best of weekend action from around the leagues
item.description: Watch the best of the action from the SPFL weekend, as Arbroath make progress at the top of the Championship and there are two thrillers in League Two.

item.title: All you need to know about Afcon 2025
item.description: BBC Sport Africa provides all the information on the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations ahead of the 35th edition of the continent's biggest sporting event.

item.title: Are Man Utd turning the tide or is a 'bad result just around corner'?
item.description: Manchester United moved into the Premier League top six with their biggest win of the season - but they still have to prove the doubters wrong.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: 'Everyone follows fashion' - is Premier League better now than 20 years ago?
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at what has changed in the Premier League in the past couple of decades and whether it is for the better, from a manager's perspective.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why is there a 15:30 Champions League match?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why there is a 15:30 GMT kick-off in the Champions League on Tuesday

item.title: What is an 'Olimpico' goal in football?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the definition of and origins behind the 'Olimpico' goal

item.title: 'It was handball, wasn't it?' - why Rutter goal against West Ham stood
item.description: Georginio Rutter's late equaliser in Brighton's 1-1 draw with West Ham on Sunday was allowed to stand despite handball claims. BBC Sport looks at the rules to explain why.

item.title: Who is Arsenal teenager Salmon?
item.description: Arsenal add 16-year-old Marli Salmon to their squad for Saturday's Premier League game against Aston Villa at Villa Park, but who is he?

item.title: When will England & Scotland find out World Cup venues?
item.description: England and Scotland will discover when and where they will play their World Cup 2026 group stage matches during a draw on Saturday.

item.title: Which team won the fewest points in a Premier League season?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at which clubs amassed the lowest points tally in a single season.

item.title: What is the dubious goals committee?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the dubious goals committee is and how the identities of goal scorers are decided

item.title: Ferencvaros seek next round with win over Rangers
item.description: Robbie Keane's Ferencvaros are looking good at home and in the Europa League as they prepare to host Rangers on Thursday.

item.title: English clubs enquire about Hibs' Mulligan - gossip
item.description: English clubs circle Hibs midfielder, "nothing" happening regarding new deal for Hearts man and Rangers defender may yet play on Monday.

item.title: Maresca, Salah & Motherwell - story of Maswanhise's rise
item.description: From release by Leicester City to the Scottish Premiership's top scorer, BBC Scotland charts the rise of Motherwell's Afcon-bound striker, Tawanda Maswanhise.

item.title: Real's Courtois asks fans to stop abuse of players
item.description: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois urges supporters to show players more "respect" after team-mate Vinicius Jr is once again the target of abuse by fans.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Nice condemn fans over 'unacceptable' player confrontation
item.description: Nice condemn a group of fans in the "strongest possible terms" after cplayers and staff were physically confronted on their return home following Sunday's 3-1 defeat at Lorient.

item.title: Bayern in advanced talks to extend Upamecano deal
item.description: Bayern Munich expect Dayot Upamecano to sign a new contract, with the defender in advanced talks over committing his future to the club.

item.title: Barca defender Araujo taking mental health break
item.description: Barcelona defender Ronald Araujo has been granted a leave of absence to "take care of himself emotionally", the club confirms.

item.title: Bristol City Women takeover by Mercury13 approved
item.description: Bristol City Women's takeover by Mercury13 is approved by WSL Football, with Lowri Roberts appointed as their interim CEO.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
